project.name: New Zealand Address Import
project.description: Tags used by the New Zealand Address Import project, which regularly updates addresses in OSM based on data from LINZ.

tags.description: Added to addresses in New Zealand
Added to addresses in New Zealand
The suburb/locality name for rural areas in New Zealand
The suburb/locality name for urban areas in New Zealand
addr:type=water is added for water addresses, which are different to street addresses
Added for water addresses in New Zealand, which are different to street addresses
Added to addresses in New Zealand that have two housenumbers. These are officially called “Alternative Addresses”.
Added to addresses in New Zealand that have two housenumbers. These are officially called “Alternative Addresses”.
Added to street addresses in New Zealand when one address node is used to represent multiple flats
Added to a very small number of street addresses in New Zealand
A unique ID used in the weekly street addresses update for New Zealand
A unique ID used to conflate hydrographic data imported from LINZ
A unique ID used to conflate topographic data imported from LINZ
A unique ID used to conflate protected areas imported from LINZ
A unique ID used to conflate pastoral lease data imported from LINZ
A unique ID used to conflate building outlines imported from LINZ
The ID of a place in the New Zealand Gazetteer. Used to conflate place names around New Zealand & Antarctica
A unique ID used to conflate campsites, huts, lodges, protected areas, and tracks imported from DOC
Added to street addresses in New Zealand if a mapper believes that the government data is wrong and should be skipped by the address update project
Temporarily added to street addresses in New Zealand if a mapper would like the script to unstack the address when it runs next, or preserve existing unstacked addresses
Added to street addresses in New Zealand if a mapper would like the script to stack multiple flats into a single address node
